title: Transparent Tribe deploys new remote access trojan in targeted attacks
executive_summary: A known threat actor group, Transparent Tribe, has introduced a new remote access trojan (RAT).
The malware enables long-term spying and system control on infected machines.
what_happened: Security researchers identified a new malware campaign linked to Transparent Tribe.
The group deployed a custom RAT to gain persistent access to victim systems.
The malware was distributed using targeted social engineering techniques.
attack_flow: Target receives a crafted document or file
Attacker gains remote access and persistence
business_impact: Loss of sensitive or strategic information
risk_reason: Targeted malware attacks are difficult to detect and can remain active for long periods without obvious signs.
